ent.origin: Old English rust, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch roest, German Rost, also to red.

p.def: a reddish- or yellowish-brown flaking coating of iron oxide that is formed on iron or steel by oxidation, especially in the presence of moisture.
p.eg: Paint protects your car from rust.

ent.rhy: adjust, august, bust, combust, crust, dust, encrust, entrust, gust, just, lust, mistrust, must, robust, thrust, trust, undiscussed
